column1: * '''?''' - Being a linguist, Tolkien decides to specialise in signalling, and learns Morse code.

column2: 2]]'''- [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[Letter 4]].
16]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] receives his degree at the [[University of Oxford]].
22]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] marries [[Edith Tolkien
29]]''' - [[William Squire]], who would play [[Gandalf]] in [[The Lord of the Rings (1978 film)]], is born.
2]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] receives orders to report in Folkestone, and prepare for embarking.
4]]''' - Tolkien leaves for France.
27]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] leaves [[wikipedia:Étaples
column3: Étaples]], and goes to the [[Battle of the Somme

column1: *'''?''' - Tolkien might have written the poem ''[[Habbanan beneath the Stars]]''.

column2: 1]]''' - One of the bloodiest battles in recent history, the [[Battle of the Somme]], starts.
1]]''' - [[Robert Gilson]] is one of the first of the 360,000 British casualties when he is hit by a shell at La Boiselle.
14]]''' - Tolkien's C-company is sent into action at the Somme front.
22]]''' - [[Ralph Payton
column3: Ralph "the Baby" Payton]], one of the [[T.C.B.S.]], is killed [[World War I

column2: 12]]''' - Tolkien writes [[Letter 5]].
19]]''' - Tolkien and [[Geoffrey Bache Smith
13]]-[[24 September
column3: 24]]''' - Revises the poem [[The Mer aid’s Flute]] and composes [[Consalatrix]], [[Affictorium]], and [[Stella Verspertina]]

column2: 19]]''' - [[Terence Tiller]], writer of the [[The Lord of the Rings (1955 radio series)
column3: 1955 radio series of ''The Lord of the Rings]]'', is born.

column2: 26]]''' - While in reserve, [[J.R.R. Tolkien]]'s battalion is inspected by [[wikipedia:Douglas Haig
column3: Sir Doulgas Haig]], the British commander at the [[Battle of the Somme]].

column2: 27]]''' - Tolkien is struck by "pyrexia of unknown origin": [[wikipedia:trench fever
8]]''' - Tolkien is repatriated, and is sent to a hospital in [[Birmingham]].
22]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] signs [[War Office form 22 November 1916
column3: a form for the War Office]], confirming his return to England from France due to trench fever.

column2: 29]]''' - [[Geoffrey Bache Smith
column3: G.B. Smith]] is hit by shrapnel, and wounded on his right arm and thigh.

column2: 3]]''' - G.B. Smith dies of gas-gangrene in his wounds. The news doesn't reach Tolkien until the 16th.
16]]-[[25 December
column3: 25]]''' - Tolkien recovers, and he and Edith visit Great Haywood.

column2: 28]]''' - [[Noel Johnson]], who would play [[Éomer]] in [[The Lord of the Rings (1955 radio series)
column3: ''The Lord of the Rings'' (1955 radio series)]], is born.

column1: *'''?'''  Canon [[Norman Power]], an acquaintance of [[J.R.R. Tolkien]], is born.
